title: So that Warrior change that got removed, why didn't they do that for Magus instead of Runeglaive?
body:
**On PBE ONLY:** Warrior lost the armor pen but dealt 10% of the physical damage you did over 3 seconds as true damage

**Bring back Magus**

Lower AP to 60 from 80
+ Lower CDR to 10% from 20% 

10% of Magic damage dealt as True Damage over 3 seconds and that amount is restored as Mana if used against Monsters. This damage is halved against Non Monsters.

**AP Jungle item** helps all Mage junglers instead of just Diana/Eve without making AP Ez OP af

Ranged champions have a ton of benefits in lane and there's always one lane in which having a ranged character is mandatory (ADC). I don't really see the problem with a jungler being melee being mandatory given the ADC has to be ranged, and it only makes sense for melee characters to be stronger in the jungle considering all ranged characters are based around being able to avoid direct confrontation with minions and jungling goes directly against this balancing.

I don't get why jungle Brand and Twitch should be a thing. They just have nothing that makes them suited to it. I don't get why everyone is so attached to the concept of EVERYONE being a viable jungler - you don't see people complaining about Evelynn not being a viable ADC, because they accept that she's just not suited to it and that's fine. Certain champions are better suited to certain roles and ranged ones are tuned to be strong in a laning scenario but not a jungle one. That's fine.

>So that Warrior change that got removed, why didn't they do that for Magus instead of Runeglaive? 

Because Runeglaive is actually viable and a pretty good item and the change to warrior would have been pointless.

Why the hell doesn't Riot just change it to the old ap jungle item? Make it were it starts with 60 ap then you stack it with each jungle camp and then you get it to 80 ap. The good thing is that it's balanced so that any ap jungler can use it.

This has the exact same issue as {{item:3726}} did before it was reworked and even now still suffers from: AP Junglers are forced to get the item and _then keep farming their jungle_ instead of **ganking** because the item has very little inherent power. It has 50 Base AP and you had to kill _fifteen big monsters_ to get it to 80 AP. The item wasn't even efficient when you bought it, you had to farm like hell to make it worth buying.

Let me put it like this: Spirit of the Ancient Golem gave Tank Junglers bonus stats for building health like they normally would anyway along with 200 health (that's the equivalent of a {{item:1028}} plus 6 Flat Health Seals) 20 armor ({{item:1029}} plus one and 2/3 of a flat armor seal at the time, now five armor seals) and 10% CDR. Thanks to the Bonus Health, those who got Ancient Golem scaled better into the late game as the item became more and more efficient. Not only that, _the item came with built-in wards._ It was literally the perfect defensive/utility item on a tanky jungler.

Spirit of the Elder Lizard gave you 30 AD (a {{item:1037}} and five AD Marks) 10% CDR and the passive which deals true damage over time. While certainly not Gold Efficient, it gave you all of the stats up-front so you could then immediately go gank a lane. Because AD is more efficient than AP (due to how AD also increases your auto attack damage in addition to abilities if you play an AD Champion) a Jungler with Spirit of the Elder Lizard had better duelling power than one with Spectral Wraith in a straight-up fight.

Wriggle's Lantern gave you 12 AD, 30% Attack Speed, a strong passive against monsters, increased gold income that you could literally free farm with unlike the old Conservation mechanic on the Elder items, _gave you free wards,_ and eventually evolved into Feral Flare which let you scale harder as the game went on. While the AD was certainly negligible, the bonus attack speed and damage bonus against monsters _essentially gave you a_ {{item:3072}} _when fighting monsters._ This was before you hit your Feral Flare.

Spectral Wraith was garbage, anyone who says otherwise either didn't play it enough at the time or didn't actually play around with the other Jungle Items. I'd sooner get on both knees and praise Runeglaive than see that garbage item return.

Problem with that is the new Ezreal changes. They basically make him reliant on Runeglaive. AP Ezreal and Runeglaive Ezreal are two completely different builds, and the only difference between them is Runeglaive Ezreal gets his power spike earlier, but he doesn't scale as well into the late game (until he switches Runeglaive out for Lich Bane, but then he has an almost useless Summoner Spell).

If they removed Runeglaive now, they'd have to restore Ezreal to form pre-Runeglaive, otherwise AP Ezreal would be a thing of the past (kind of like AP Rengar), and not to mention, SivHD would be out of a job.

I believe they should seek to limit some junglers that can make massive advantage of Runeglaive (not just 'using' it, as that's the point of the item, but the ones that make it overpowered), but also add Magus back. Sure we would have 2 AP Enchantments, but so what? It's not like it'll really effect us in the long run. No one can build two Enchantments.

Anyway, just my two cents.

This is either hilariously broken or hilariously useless.

True damage nuke based on magic damage dealt is really strong on a a lot of mages, but is beyond broken on a lot of poke mages. Poke mages aren't widely viable in the jungle, but you won't see them in the jngle because this is going to be abused by poke mages everywhere to a point Ezreal never did with Runeglaive.

At the same time look at the stats. It trades the sheen proc, mana, and a MASSIVE chunk of its mana regeneration for 10 AP and the passive. If this is supposed to be good, it's going to be good for the passive, and the passive is going to be abused by laners.

As a hilarious side note, this will actually get procced on every auto attack on jungle monsters because the jungler passive deals magic damage to monsters.
Perhaps because that doesn't add anything to the way you play, as opposed to runeglaive.
